page.title: 20Village Shops
page.content: The village shops offer limited goods to the villagers and the prices tend to be higher than those in a town.This is not the fault of the shop-keepers as they have to pay extra for transporting the goods.There are three grocers,a butchers,a post-office and fancy-goods shop,a junk shop run by an ex-belly dancer and a haberdasher's which is up for sale as it has not been making money.The main village population do their shopping in Dumfries or to a lesser extent Thornhill and use the village shops only when they run out of things. Because of the poor bus service however,many people have to shop in the village,particularly the elderly, and the food shops can be surprisingly busy.
